intro: Hieracium pseudamplidentatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium pseudamplidentatum is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable habitats.
